H0.text: who won the battle of stirling bridge 1297. William Wallace

H1.text: who won the battle of stirling bridge 1297. John de Warenne

H2.text: who won the battle of stirling bridge 1297. James Stewart

H3.text: who won the battle of stirling bridge 1297. Andrew Moray

A4.text: Andrew Moray and William Wallace defeated the combined English forces of John de Warenne, 6th Earl of Surrey, and Hugh de Cressingham near Stirling, on the River Forth.

A5.text: On 11 September 1297, an army jointly led by Wallace and Andrew Moray won the Battle of Stirling Bridge.

A6.text: The English feudal army of 3,000 cavalry and 8,000 to 10,000 infantry met disaster as they crossed over to the north side of the river.
